display_title.display_title:
Timor Leste - Gas Seep Harvesting
            Project : environmental assessment

docna.cdata!:
Timor Leste - Gas Seep Harvesting Project :
            environmental assessment

repnme.cdata!:
Timor Leste - Gas Seep Harvesting Project :
            environmental assessment

admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific
trustfund:
TF054670-BNPP-ENERGY: ASIA SUSTAINABLE
            AND ALTERNATIVE ENERGY PROGRAM(ASTAE)

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Environmental
            Management Plan (EA) for the Gas Seep Harvesting Project for
            Timor-Leste was to identify the potential effects of gas
            collection, electrical generation facilities and electrical
            distribution lines on the local population and the
            environment, develop a management methodology to minimize
            the risks and potential adverse environmental effects within
            the area of influence of the project. As a result of this
            assessment the EA suggest mitigation measures, including :
            before any staff member of EDTL or contractor undertake
            construction, operation maintenance or repairs they will be
            trained in health and safety requirements and follow the
            procedures set out in the Site Health and Safety Plan;
            engine-generator units will be installed such that spilled
            lubricants are contained and collected; clearing of
            vegetation will be done manually or mechanically, no
            pesticides will be used; before clearing, the route will be
            clearly marked, including number of trees to be cut;
            trenches and / or embankment will be dug around construction
            sites to contain any erosion and run-off solid waste;
            construction will be conducted during dry season and during
            daylight normal hours; fuels and lubricants will be stored
            in sealed containers in designated areas; flare will be 2.5
            meters above ground and a security fence at a distance of 10
            meters from flare to ensure no hazard to workers and public;
            every 6 months inspections will be conducted to identify any
            leaking of transformers oils or lubricants; noisy equipment
            will be housed in sound-attenuating enclosures to reduce the
            amount of noise generated.
